meanings.definition: In a way that promotes unity among different Christian churches.
meanings.sent1: The church leaders gathered ecumenically to discuss ways to work together.
meanings.sent2: The conference was organized ecumenically to involve all denominations.
meanings.sent3: The friendly competition between the churches was ecumenically amusing.
meanings.sent4: Their joint efforts to help the community were ecumenically inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The choir sang ecumenically, blending voices from various congregations.

meanings.definition: In a way that is inclusive of all different religious groups.
meanings.sent1: The event was planned ecumenically to welcome people of all faiths.
meanings.sent2: She spoke ecumenically, acknowledging the beliefs of everyone present.
meanings.sent3: The potluck dinner was ecumenically delicious with dishes from various cultures.
meanings.sent4: His message of peace resonated ecumenically with diverse religious communities.
meanings.sent5: The festival celebrated ecumenically, honoring traditions from around the world.

meanings.definition: In a way that is universal or worldwide in scope.
meanings.sent1: The charity organization operates ecumenically, reaching people globally.
meanings.sent2: The artist's work is displayed ecumenically in museums across continents.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a universal language was ecumenically intriguing.
meanings.sent4: Technology has connected us ecumenically, bridging distances effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The concept of peace is understood ecumenically by cultures around the world.
